trigger.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

dependency.name: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: {Template Module ICMP Ping:icmppingloss.min(5m)}>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and {Template Module ICMP Ping:icmppingloss.min(5m)}<100

item.name: Number of manager to send traps
item.description: The number of managers to send traps to.

item.name: Last replaced date
item.description: The date when the UPS system's batteries were last replaced in mm/dd/yy format. For UPS models, this value is originally set in the factory. When the UPS batteries are replaced, this value should be reset by the administrator.

item.name: Battery status
item.description: The status of the UPS batteries. A batteryLow(3) value indicates the UPS will be unable to sustain the current load, and its services will be lost if power is not restored. The amount of run time in reserve at the time of low battery can be configured by the upsSmartConfigLowBatteryRunTime.

item.name: Battery time on
item.description: The elapsed time in seconds since the UPS has switched to battery power.

item.name: Plugged devices
item.description: The number of devices that are plugged into the UPS.

item.name: Battery conserve control
item.description:
Setting this variable to turnUpsOffToConserveBattery(2) causes a UPS on battery to be put into 'sleep' mode immediately. The (10) means suspending time(10 minutes) before turn off UPS. UPS will turn back on when utility power is restored. Attempting to turn off a UPS that is not on battery will result in a badValue error.
Setting this value to noTurnOffUps(1) has no effect.
The value noTurnOffUps(1) will always be returned when the variable is read.

item.name: UPS ID
item.description: An 8 byte ID string identifying the UPS. This object can be set by the administrator

item.name: Output status
item.description: The current state of the UPS. If the UPS is unable to determine the state of the UPS this variable is set to unknown(1)

item.name: Environment over humidity
item.description: Alarm dupsAlarmOverHumidity on when the environment humidity over the value.

item.name: Environment over temperature
item.description: Alarm dupsAlarmOverTemperature on when the environment temperature over the value.

item.name: Environment under humidity
item.description: Alarm dupsAlarmUnderHumidity on when the environment humidity below the value

item.name: Environment under temperature
item.description: Alarm dupsAlarmUnderTemperature on when the environment temperature below the value.

item.name: Control ups off
item.description:
Setting this variable to turnUpsOff(2) causes the UPS to shut off. When in this state, the UPS will not provide output power regardless of the input line state. The on/off switch on the UPS must be toggled for the UPS to return to operation.
Setting this value to noTurnUpsOff(1) has no effect.
The value noTurnUpsOff(1) will always be returned when the variable is read.

item.name: Battery capacity
item.description: The remaining battery capacity expressed in percent of full capacity.

item.name: Battery current of maximum current
item.description: The current battery current expressed in percent of maximum current.

item.name: Battery full charge voltage
item.description: The fully charged battery voltage of the battery system used in the UPS, expressed in tenths of a volt.

item.name: Battery replace indicator
item.description: Indicates whether the UPS batteries need replacing.

item.name: Battery time remaining
item.description: The UPS battery run time remaining before battery exhaustion, in seconds.

item.name: Battery temperature
item.description: The current internal UPS temperature expressed in tenths of a Celsius degree.

item.name: Battery current voltage
item.description: The current battery voltage expressed in 1/10 VDC

item.name: Alarm
item.description: A flag indicating how the UPS should handle audible line fail alarms.

item.name: Alarm timer
item.description:
The time in seconds after initial line failure at which the UPS begins emitting audible alarms (beeping). This timer is observerd only if the value of extControlAlarm is timed(2). Allowed values are 0 or 30 seconds.
If a value other than a supported value is provided in a set request, the UPS interprets it as a the next lower acceptable value. If the provided value is lower than the lowest acceptable value, the lowest acceptable value is used.

item.name: Hight transfer voltage
item.description:
The maximum line voltage in 1/10 VAC allowed before the UPS system transfers to battery backup. Allowed value depend on the UPS used:
120 Volt units allow settings of 1290, 1320, 1350, 1380. 100 Volt units allow settings of 1080, 1100, 1120, 1140. 230 Volt units allow settings of 2530, 2640, 2710, 2800. 208 Volt units allow settings of 2240, 2290, 2340, 2390.
If a value other than a supported value is provided in a set request, the UPS interprets it as the next lower acceptable value. If the provided value is lower than the lowest acceptable value, the lowest acceptable value is used.

item.name: Low battery run time
item.description:
The desired run time in seconds once the low battery condition is reached. Allowed values are 120, 300, 420, or 600 seconds. During this time the UPS will produce a constant warning tone which can not be disabled.
If a value other than a supported value is provided in a set request, the UPS interprets it as a the next higher acceptable value. If the provided value is higher than the highest acceptable value, the highest acceptable value is used.

item.name: Low transfer voltage
item.description:
The minimum line voltage in 1/10 VAC allowed before the UPS system transfers to battery backup.
Allowable values depend on the UPS used: 120 Volt units allow settings of 970, 1000, 1030, 1060. 100 Volt units allow settings of 810, 830, 850, 870. 230 Volt units allow settings of 1880, 1960, 2040, 2080. 208 Volt units allow settings of 1680, 1720, 1770, 1820.
If a value other than a supported value is provided in a set request, the UPS interprets it as a the next higher acceptable value. If the provided value is higher than the highest acceptable value, the highest acceptable value is used.

item.name: Minimim return capacity
item.description:
The minimum battery capacity as a percent of full capacity required before the UPS will return from a low battery shutdown condition. In other words, the UPS will not re-energize the output until the battery capacity is equal to this value. Allowed values are 0, 10, 25, or 90 percent.
If a value other than a supported value is provided in a set request, the UPS interprets it as a the next higher acceptable value. If the provided value is higher than the highest acceptable value, the highest acceptable value is used.

item.name: Rated output voltage
item.description: The nominal output voltage from the UPS in 1/10 VAC. Possible values are 1000, 1200, 2080, 2200, 2250, 2300 and 2400. NOTE: Only units that are 2200, 2250, 2300 and 2400 can be changed. Allowable values are 2200, 2250, 2300 and 2400. For these adjustable units, if a value other than a supported value is provided in a set request, the UPS interprets it as the next lower acceptable value. If the provided value is lower than the lowest acceptable value, the lowest acceptable value is used.

item.name: Return delay
item.description:
The delay in seconds after utility line power returns before the UPS will turn on. This value is also used when the UPS comes out of a reboot and before the UPS wakes up from 'sleep' mode. Allowed values are 0, 60, 180 and 300 seconds.
If a value other than a supported value is provided in a set request, the UPS interprets it as a the next higher acceptable value. If the provided value is higher than the highest acceptable value, the highest acceptable value is used.

item.name: Sensitivity
item.description: The sensitivity of the UPS to utility line abnormalities or noises.

item.name: Set EEPROM defaults
item.description: WRITE: Resets the UPS EEPROM variables to default values. READ: returns 0

item.name: Shut off delay
item.description:
The delay in seconds the UPS remains on after being told to turn off. Allowed values are 12, 18, 24, 30, 36, 42, 48, 54, 60, 120, 180, 240, 300, 360, 420, 480, 540, and 600 seconds.
If a value other than a supported value is provided in a set request, the UPS interprets it as next higher acceptable value. If the provided value is higher than the highest acceptable value, the highest acceptable value is used.

item.name: UPS sleep time
item.description:
The time in minutes for the UPS to go to 'sleep' when instructed. When in sleep mode, the UPS will not provide output power regardless of the input line state. Once the specified time has elapsed, output power will be restored.
This is a configuration setting. The UPS will not go to sleep until told to do so by the manager from a management station.
Any input value is allowed, however the UPS only recognizes 0 - 9999 minutes in one minute increments.
If the provided value is higher than the highest acceptable value, the highest acceptable value is used.

item.name: Control flash and beep
item.description:
UPS to identify itself by lighting all indicators and beeping.
Setting this variable to FlashAndBeep(2) causes the UPS lights all panel indicators and beeps.
Setting this value to noFlashAndBeep(1) has no effect.
The value noFlashAndBeep(1) will always be returned when the variable is read.

item.name: Control reboot ups
item.description:
Setting this variable to rebootUps(2) causes the UPS to shut off and turn back on.
Setting this value to noRebootUps(1) has no effect.
The value noRebootUps(1) will always be returned when the variable is read.

item.name: Control simulate power fail
item.description:
Setting this variable to simulatePowerFailure(2) causes the UPS switch to battery power.
Setting this value to noSimulatePowerFailure(1) has no effect.
The value noSimulatePowerFailure(1) will always be returned when the variable is read.

item.name: Control turn on ups load
item.description:
Setting this variable to upsSmartControlTurnOnUpsLoad(2) causes the UPS switch back to utility power if utility power is present.
Setting this value to noUpsSmartControlTurnOnUpsLoad(1) has no effect.
The value noUpsSmartControlTurnOnUpsLoad(1) will always be returned when the variable is read.

item.name: Control ups sleep
item.description:
Setting this variable to putUpsToSleep(2) causes the UPS to go to sleep for the time specified by upsSmartConfigUpsSleepTime.
When in sleep mode, the UPS will not provide output power regardless of the input line state. Once the specified time has elapsed, output power will be restored.
Setting this value to noPutUpsToSleep(1) has no effect.
The value noPutUpsToSleep(1) will always be returned when the variable is read.

item.name: SNMP Proxy agent firmware revision
item.description: The firmware revision of the UPS SNMP Proxy agent.

item.name: Manufactured date
item.description: The date when the UPS was manufactured in mm/dd/yy format.

item.name: Firmware revision
item.description: The firmware revision of the UPS system.

item.name: Serial number
item.description: An 8-character string identifying the serial number of the UPS internal microprocessor. This number is set at the factory. NOTE: This number does NOT correspond to the serial number on the rear of the UPS.

item.name: Input frequency
item.description: The current input frequency to the UPS system in 1/10 Hz.

item.name: Input line fail cause
item.description: The reason for the occurrence of the last transfer to UPS battery power. The variable is set to noTransfer(1) if there is no transfer yet. The variable is set to highLineVoltage(2) if the transfer to battery is caused by an over voltage greater than the high transfer voltage. The variable is set to brownout(3) if the duration of the outage is greater than five seconds and the line voltage is between 40 percent of the rated output voltage and the low transfer voltage. The variable is set to blackout(4) if the duration of the outage is greater than five seconds and the line voltage is between 40 percent of the rated output voltage and ground. The variable is set to smallMomentarySag(5) if the duration of the outage is less than five seconds and the line voltage is between 40 percent of the rated output voltage and the low transfer voltage. The variable is set to deepMomentarySag(6) if the duration of the outage is less than five seconds and the line voltage is between 40 percent of the rated output voltage and ground.

item.name: Input line voltage
item.description: The current utility line voltage in 1/10 VAC

item.name: Input maximum line voltage
item.description: The maximum utility line voltage in 1/10 VAC over the previous 1 minute period.

item.name: Input minimum line voltage
item.description: The minimum utility line voltage in 1/10 VAC over the previous 1 minute period.

item.name: Output frequency
item.description: The current output frequency of the UPS system in 1/10 Hz.

item.name: Output load
item.description: The current UPS load expressed in percent of rated capacity.

item.name: Output voltage
item.description: The output voltage of the UPS system in 1/10 VAC.

item.name: Test calibration date
item.description: The date the last UPS runtime calibration was performed in mm/dd/yy format.

item.name: Test calibration results
item.description:
The results of the last runtime calibration.
Value ok(1) means a successful runtime calibration.
Value invalidTest(2) indicates last calibration did not take place since the battery capacity was below 100 percent.
Value calibrationInProgress(3) means a calibration is occurring now.

item.name: Test diagnostics
item.description:
Setting this variable to testDiagnostics(2) causes the UPS to perform a diagnostic self test.
Setting this value to noTestDiagnostics(1) has no effect.
The value noTestDiagnostics(1) will always be returned when the variable is read.

item.name: Test diagnostic schedule
item.description: The UPS system's automatic battery test schedule.

item.name: Diagnostics results
item.description: The results of the last UPS diagnostics test performed.

item.name: Test indicators
item.description:
Setting this variable to testIndicators(2) causes the UPS to perform a front panel indicator (lights) test.
Setting this value to noTestIndicators(1) has no effect.
The value noTestIndicators(1) will always be returned when the variable is read.

item.name: Last diagnostics date
item.description: The date the last UPS diagnostics test was performed in mm/dd/yy format.

item.name: Test runtime calibration
item.description:
Setting this variable to performCalibration(2) causes the UPS to discharge to calibrate the UPS. The test will only start if the battery capacity is 100 percent. The test runs until capacity is less than 25 percent.
Setting this variable to cancelCurrentCalibration(3) after setting performCalibration(2) will cancel the current discharge.
Setting this variable to noPerformCalibration(1) will have no effect.
The value noPerformCalibration(1) will always be returned when the variable is read.
The result of the calibration will be saved in upsSmartTestCalibrationResult.

item.name: Three phase bypss source voltage R
Three phase bypss source voltage S
Three phase bypss source voltage T
Three phase DC and rectifier status battery status
Three phase DC and rectifier status charge status
Three phase DC and rectifier status in and out
Three phase DC and rectifier status low battery
Three phase DC and rectifier status low battery shutdown
Three phase DC and rectifier status rectifier operating
Three phase DC and rectifier status rectifier rotation error
Three phase fault status bypass breaker
Three phase fault status emergency stop
Three phase fault status high DC shutdown
Three phase fault status inverter output fail
Three phase fault status over temperature
Three phase fault status short circuit
Three phase output load percentage R
Three phase output load percentage S
Three phase output load percentage T
Three phase UPS static switch mode
Three phase UPS status AC status
Three phase UPS status bypass frequency fail
Three phase UPS status inverter operating
Three phase UPS status manual bypass breaker

item_prototype.name: Device {#UPSDEVICENAME} accept
item_prototype.description: An entry is added if yes, the entry is deleted if no.

item_prototype.name: Device {#UPSDEVICENAME} id
item_prototype.description: The index of the device that is plugged into the UPS.

item_prototype.name: Devices {#UPSDEVICENAME} rating
item_prototype.description: The volt-amp rating of the device plugged into the UPS

item_prototype.name: Receiver {#TRAPID} accept
item_prototype.description: An entry will become active if yes, and will be deleted if no.

item_prototype.name: Receiver {#TRAPID} community string
item_prototype.description: The community name to use in the trap when sent to the manager.

item_prototype.name: Severity level {#TRAPID}
item_prototype.description: The severity threshold of traps to send to the manager. Traps are labeled in severity as informational(1), warning(2), severe(3). Only traps of equal or greater severity than this value are sent to the manager.

item_prototype.name: Trap {#TRAPID} receiver address
item_prototype.description: The IP address of the manager to send a trap to.
